text: How do I make a python regex like "(.
*)" such that, given "a (b) c (d) e" python matches "b" instead of "b) c (d"?
I know that I can use "[^)]" instead of ".
", but I'm looking for a more general solution that keeps my regex a little cleaner.
Is there any way to tell python "hey, match this as soon as possible"?
